content.rendered:
Before we begin, let us pay respect to the legendary Kobe Bryant and all those who lost their lives in the helicopter crash yesterday evening. It is a huge loss to the sporting world and may the families that lost people in that crash have the fortitude to bear the loss.

Barcelona loses under new management..

Well, that did not take too long. Barcelona had loads of possession but did not do much with it as they barely had any shots on target while Valencia was more direct, heck, they even lost a penalty in the process. Lionel Messi was subdued with no support from the midfield or his wide men in Griezmann and Ansu Fati. The reality with this team still is the fact that very little else can be done if Messi does not contribute- directly or indirectly. Only time will tell if Setien is the right choice.

For Valencia, this was a well deserved win, something that they had not accomplished since 2007. Things could start to look up now as they can kick on towards the Champions League spot.

Real Madrid wins again..

Real Madrid keep doing what they know how to do best-not play so well, be very compact at the back and nick in the odd goal or two. This has worked for them so far as they are three points clear at the top. Casemiro got them all the points in the last game-week and Nacho was the one to be thanked for the solitary goal in this game. Thibaut Courtois is having one of the best seasons in his career and it seems to be gradually going under the radar. All of Real Madrid would want it to stay that way.

The Serie A title race becomes more suspenseful..

When Inter Milan drew with Cagliari the day before, it seemed like Juventus would stroll to struggling Napoli and leave with three points. It was not to be as Napoli gave a good showing, were two goals up before having to dig deep to take all three points. Juventus still lead with three points- two if Lazio wins their game in hand. Nothing is set in stone yet. This may as well go down the wire.

In the Rome derby, Lazio and Roma were held to a draw with a very memorable goal by Acerbi.

Elsewhere, Atalanta scored 7 goals away from home. Arguably the most entertaining team in Europe.

RB Leipzig lose advantage..

Leipzig lost away to Freiburg, also not scoring in the process. Unfortunately, every other team around them took advantage. The gap has been cut to one point. The pressure is on.

We may need to do an Erling Haaland watch at this rate as he has 5 goals in less than 80 minutes. Talk about making a mark!

jetpack-related-posts.title: Luis Enrique exit puts Premier League clubs on Messi and Neymar alert
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: From a Premier League perspective, the immediate reaction to Luis Enrique announcing he will step down as Barcelona coach at the end of the season has centred solely on the managers who could be lured to Catalonia to replace him at the Nou Camp. Arsenal's Arsene Wenger, perhaps? Or Tottenham…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Barcelona: Ernesto Valverde replaces Luis Enrique as manager
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Ernesto Valverde was Athletic Bilbao boss for the past four years Barcelona have appointed Ernesto Valverde as their head coach on a two-year deal, with an option for a third. Former Barca forward Valverde announced last week that he was leaving Athletic Bilbao after four years in charge. He replaces…

jetpack-related-posts.title: THE WEEKEND REVIEW.
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Tottenham away blues continues.. For a team that is one of the big boys these days, Tottenham’s away form since the beginning of the year has been nothing to write home about. On Saturday, the woeful form continued as Leicester City produced a very good comeback to steal all three…

jetpack-related-posts.title: BARCELONA: MOVING IN THE RIGHT DIRECTION?
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: In case you have not noticed, Barcelona is under new Management. The change was made in the middle of the season. They were top of the La Liga, although they just lost in the Spanish Super Cup to Atletico Madrid. A relatively irrelevant game in the grand scheme of things.…

jetpack-related-posts.title: The weekend review
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: A Merseyside Derby to remember… Thankfully, Sadio Mane more or less ensured that we saw an entertaining game by scoring very early on. Ultimately, Liverpool should feel hard done by especially considering the fact that Van Dijk was injured early on – with no punishment to Pickford, the culprit- and…

jetpack-related-posts.title: What Next for Barcelona?
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: It is not every time that you get to see Barcelona not win the League. It is also not every time that Barcelona sacks a manager that is top of the League as at the time of the sacking. It is also not every time your main striker gets injured…
